comments.text:
When I go to the page:

https://github.com/bucardo/check_postgres/blob/master/check_postgres.pl

Firefox 4.0 freezes, taking a couple minutes to load the page in being generally very slow and unresponsive (for example, using CTRL-F it takes 1-2 seconds per key press) even after the page is loaded.  Note that this page crashes 3.5 (so 4.0 is an improvement), but Chrome is able to load the page and become responsive once all code is loaded.

Note: this is testing on an Ubuntu 10.10 Dell Netbook with an atom processor and 1GB of RAM, so a constrained-resource situation.
comments.creator: josh@agliodbs.com

comments.raw_text: very fast with Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110120 Firefox/4.0b10pre SeaMonkey/2.1b2pre and an Core2Duoi3 with 3GB RAM

comments.author: josh@agliodbs.com
comments.raw_text:
Matti,

Yes, I think this is specicially an issue when FB doesn't have a lot of RAM or CPU available.  However, that's a target area for improvement in FB4, so it's worth reporting the bug.
comments.creator: josh@agliodbs.com
